institution: Human Resources Development Service of Korea
category: Skill Competition Management Rules/Article 23 (Occupational Council Operation)
contents: Article 23 (Operation of Occupational Council) ① Councils may be formed and operated for each occupation to promote athlete development by widely disseminating the relevant occupation and to develop the skill competition business. ② The occupational council may consist of instructors from athlete training institutions, It is composed of officials from organizations related to the occupation, industrial field experts, and academic experts. If necessary, such as collecting opinions and announcing important matters, the head of the division, head of examination, or deputy examiner of the relevant occupation may attend. Revised on February 22, 2018, ③ The Occupational Council shall be operated for non-profit purposes as an autonomous consultative body of the relevant occupation, and must comply with the regulations set by the Korean Committee in relation to skill competitions., ④ The Korean Council shall be presented by the Occupational Council. Your opinion can be reflected in the operation of the skills competition business.
